content: to next edge st of adjacent square through 2* until 1 *tfs into the gap after the next st* 6 times row 3 8 loop remains on connect to next edge st of adjacent square hook row 4 repeat row 2 8 row 5 repeat row 3 8 row 6 repeat row 2 8 *single_crochet by inserting hook as per tfs into the gap after the next st* 6 times slip_stitch in same st as bind off connecting st on row 6 once all squares are completed slip st to the base of the first square to complete the round panel e repeat panel c tss square panel f attach your working yarn to the top point of a square before starting the first square this square is a false rib stitch a one row two stitch pattern repeat using tss and twisted up tss be sure to hold your hook up rather than down to grab the yarn grabbing the hook with it pointed down would give a twisted down effect which is different and not desired for this pattern watch this video for a demonstration of how to make this square correctly https //youtu be/ucb9- 89l8qw repeat this square until all the v shapes between the squares are filled loops on false rib square retp hook pick up a loop in each single_crochet of the square below *yarn over pull row 1 8 connect to 1st edge st of adjacent square through 2* until 1 row *tss twisted up tss* 3 times loop remains on 8 2-6 connect to next edge st of adjacent square hook bind *single_crochet in tss single_crochet into twisted up tss by inserting hook as per twisted up tss before completing off the single_crochet* 3 times slip_stitch in same st as connecting st on row 6 once all squares are completed slip st to the base of the first square to complete the round © abbeymade 2021 5 tessellated sampler cowl panel g repeat panel c tss square panel h attach your working yarn to the top point of a square before starting the first square this square made from honeycomb stitch which is made with alternating tss and tps demonstrated in this video https //youtu be/kzpe8uiimna repeat this square until all the v shapes between the squares are filled loops on honeycomb square retp hook pick up a loop in each single_crochet of the square below connect to 1st row 1 8 *yarn over edge st of adjacent square pull through row 2 *tss tps* 3 times connect to next edge st of adjacent square 8 2* until 1 row 3 *tps tss* 3 times connect to next edge st of adjacent square 8 loop row 4 repeat row 2 8 remains on row 5 repeat row 3 8 hook row 6 repeat row 2 8 bind *single_crochet by inserting hook as per tps then single_crochet into next st* 3 times slip_stitch in same st as off connecting st on row 6 once
